website_summaries.verdict: Despite some quirks, this handy gadget is quite affordable and is ideal for anyone who is concerned about the environment.
pros: Distances itself from others for its hand-cranked operation that doesn't need electricity
Small size works well in tight spaces
cons: Requires a bit of time and strength to operate
Only holds 5 pounds at a time
Longevity of some of its components is questionable

customer_reviews.title: How to Maximize Cleaning
customer_reviews.text: Both the good and bad reviews of this little washer are correct. It depends on how you use it. If you spin it slowly so the clothes drop from top to bottom each revolution, the clothes are slammed down through the hot soapy water 60 times per minute. So two minutes of cranking slams them through the water 120 times and they come out sparkling clean. If you spin it faster, centrifugal force keeps the clothes at one end of the washer, and you end up with wet, dirty clothes. I love mine!
customer_reviews.author: tinycamper

customer_reviews.title: I received a used product even though I ordered a ...
customer_reviews.text: I received a used product even though I ordered a new one. Check thoroughly as soon as you unpack it.
customer_reviews.author: Manoj

customer_reviews.title: Don't Bother
customer_reviews.text: Beats the color out of clothes more than anything else. Screws popped out every time I cranked, so I had to glue them in, and was later unable to get them back out to return it, when I realized it was all-around useless. It's certainly untrue that this thing uses less water than handwashing. It's nearly impossible to rinse all soap out, or even to drain it completely. Couldn't find anyone to take the thing so it went in the garbage, waste of $45. I'll stick to more effort and time hand washing, rather than use this.
customer_reviews.author: Zwaanhild

customer_reviews.title: great little off-grid washer!
customer_reviews.text: I live off the grid in my self-built tiny house on wheels. I finally put up a line and purchased this unit to save a little bit of money, but more so to save on trips to the laundromat. It works great for t-shirts, socks, underwear, polypro activewear etc. I still have to take my Carhartt pants and jeans to the laundromat 2 times/month.No biggy. Depending on your situation, this little unit could work for you as well as it does for me!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew T. Kolb

customer_reviews.title: Really wanted to like this but I just can't
customer_reviews.text: Save your money and just hand wash laundry in a bucket. Requires almost as much water as a regular washing machine once you consider it's only designed to clean a couple/few t-shirts or a single pair of jeans at a time, following the instructions to the letter left clothes that were not fully clean nor fully rinsed. Really wanted to like this but I just can't.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cosst me $58 to send it back to Neptune Electronics
customer_reviews.text: I bought this machine from Neptune Electronics for $189.98, but the parts did not fit correctly, So I sent it back for a refund. They had sent me a label that stated that I had to pay for shipping. So UPS charged me $58 for shipping. One just cannot afford to send this back except they had charged me so much to begin with. I ordered another from Laundry Alternative for $56. I got it today and put it together. The parts just do not fit well. I had to force the parts together and the small finishing pins will not go in place at all.
customer_reviews.author: SS

customer_reviews.title: A miracle has happenned
customer_reviews.text: Finally someone invented something that is good for the planet. That doesn't need electricity. I m so thrilled about the money I m saving!😄! I did one load the first day it came to my house. It takes a little time , but you can do it while you are talking in the phone or watching your telenovela. The only bad thing is where do you hide your washed underware from those neighbors that have a second floor? From now on I m not having any dirty clothes in the bin.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Tomoyasu

customer_reviews.title: Did not expect much and still was disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: The Wonderwash is flimsy, leaky, and simply not effective. I am perplexed as to how there are so many high ratings for this device. I ordered the Wonderwash with low expectations and have still been disappointed. I was seeking something I could use to pre-clean / pre-rinse really dirty clothes from things like Tough Mudder runs before they hit (and clogged) my washing machine. I thought Wonderwash could work – at least a little. It does not! Other than getting my cloths wet, it seems to do nothing but leak when I turn it.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Roach

customer_reviews.title: It works for me
customer_reviews.text: Got it with a spin dryer. Keeps me from using a crowded laundry room where they are mostly offended by people who wear face masks and like social distancing. I presoak, don't over-pack with clothes and keep up with the wash. In other words, know how to do laundry from my mom and her generation. Checked YouTube and saw how others used it too. Then you figure it out for you.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Plastic was pink and white and spoiled white clothes
customer_reviews.text: The item I received was made of a mix of pink and white plastic. Although I have no complaints about the washing abilities this item’s pink/red bel into several of my whites which I washed separately (one of the main reasons I bought it, for delicates and whites (more often also delicates) and by the time I used on my whites it was too late to return. VERY upset, those items were not cheap
customer_reviews.author: marie james

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality control
customer_reviews.text: The reviews are good, but the one I received was not properly checked for quality. It leaks from the seam that holds the top and bottom half together. Unfortunately, we didn't use it until 6 weeks after it arrived, as we purchased it for an extended camping trip. So in spite of reinforcing the seam with duct tape, I and the table get splattered every time I use it. It is still better than trying to hand wash clothes. But I prefer it to work. Since it was too late to return it, I ordered it from another seller on sale for 1/4 the usual price. Crossing my fingers that it will be intact and work as expected!
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: It is great but be realistic on load size.
customer_reviews.text: This thing really does clean very well if you use it properly. The thing isn't for big loads. I did about 7 t-shirts in it at a time and a few other loads were things like boxers or my work uniforms. You have to keep a realistic expectation of what you can fit in there but it's a short wash cycle that it evens out. I recommend doing two rinse cycles to get out the detergent. Definitely would recommend. If you use it in the tub, you don't notice any wobble that others have mentioned.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Macon

customer_reviews.title: hand washer
customer_reviews.text: This thing is pretty cool. Few minutes and you have some washes clothes. Doesnt hold a lot of clothing but works pretty good in my experience. I used it for a few months and now just occasionally. Worst point for me is the base. If they could have it made of maybe metal or aluminum it would be much more sturdy. I think that's the weakest point. Flexes during heavier washes, suction cups don't always work out. But it sure got the dirt outta the clothes I washed
customer_reviews.author: Danny D

customer_reviews.title: Can't say enough good things
customer_reviews.text: I was in need of something to wash my daughter's cloth diapers without ruining them.and get the smell out. I didn't think this would work that great. But it does! I wind it for 3 to 4 minutes just to be sure. I make sure that I put water in before and soap in before clothes! You don't need much soap read the directions! It drains ok. It doesn't wring out so you have to wring clothes out. I've included photos I did it outside bc it's nice out but plan on doing in the tub. It got my clothes are so clean and I fit quite a bit in it! I'd deff recommend this product. I want another one!
customer_reviews.author: Kimbre E Suckow

customer_reviews.title: Waste of $
customer_reviews.text: Might as well do the laundry in the sink.. this thing is awful and over priced. So hard to turn it. And takes forever to get the soap out, the clothes are never clean.
customer_reviews.author: Dogmom&Welder

customer_reviews.title: Everyone Needs One
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for one of my daughters to wash cloth diaper inserts in. She doesn’t have enough on a daily basis to justify the big machine. She loves it. Her 12yo, 10Yo and 8yo use it with ease and feel like they are helping with the baby. They even think it so wondrous, they will do a load of their own clothes! I had one when I first married, back in 1984 and wash my husband’s dirty work jeans— he was a welder in a shop with a dirt floor. Got even those nasties clean.
customer_reviews.author: Chakwaina

customer_reviews.title: Not a washer replacement, but great for most laundry needs
customer_reviews.text: Works great, but it is work. It takes several times getting the soap out of the laundry. I wouldn't do more than a few loads at a time be cause it'll be a long night. I wouldn't plan to use it for clothes that have stains to get out or socks/underwear. I use this to wash cloth diapers and it works! It gets the urine smell completely out!
customer_reviews.author: Rocio Camarena

customer_reviews.title: Great little machine!
customer_reviews.text: I love this product! It really gets my clothes clean and I love not having to rely on electricity to wash my clothes. The suction cups aren't useful to me because I use it on a wooden picnic table outside, but it's one heck of a product! In two loads I was able to clean a pair of jeans, 3 men's xl t-shirts, a pair of workout pants, a camisole, four pillow cases, three pairs of underwear, 2 pairs of socks and a tea towel.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Layer

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: I don't have a washer/dryer hookup, and I hate laundromats. This washer was worth my money and the time it takes to operate it. It can fit my queen-size flat sheet, fitted sheet, and pillowcases all at once. I washed my dog's bed in it. Everything comes out smelling fresh and clean, and it doesn't take that long. I just load/crank/drain it all in my bathtub. I tried the drainage arm once but it's a lot faster for me to just take out the wet laundry, wring it out, dump the dirty water, and stuff the laundry back in for a "rinse cycle." Compared with air-drying and folding, this is actually the least annoying part of my laundry routine.
customer_reviews.author: nobody

customer_reviews.title: High expectations- thankfully it was on sale.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this thinking it would save me with laundry costs, since it's just me in the house. It leaks. Therefore, I use it in my tub and smash the crap out of my hand. It was on sale at the time and I was just trying it out. If you had VERY lightly soiled clothing and were camping this would be better than nothing, but I wouldn't recommend it. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: C. Holmes

customer_reviews.title: Great washer
customer_reviews.text: I've experimented with washing by hand and other products like this before to cut back on money and to be more green. Living in San Francisco the cost, convenience and how well it cleans makes this one of the best things I've bought on amazon because of how practical it is and price point. If the trip warrants it I will definitely take it with me. For all these reasons I give it a solid 4
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Won't replace a machine, but might be helpful to have...
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble the main frame, light, well- designed. No leakage from the lid. The suction cups on the base are quite helpful holding the frame steady as you rotate the drum. I can see myself using this for small to medium loads of light material. However, the drain does not fully drain the drum (and the joint where the drain pipe attaches to the drum does leak during the draining process). This is why I would not use this for towels or denim - lightweight materials only, and nothing bulky because you do have to manually wring the wash before hanging it to dry. I will update my review if I figure out how to use it more effectively.
customer_reviews.author: Tana Be

customer_reviews.title: I am using it like it says
customer_reviews.text: This does what it says, however it is about as leak proof as a sieve. The third go round with it loaded always splashes water until you release the pressure and try again. Also it seems to randomly pop the lid off and spray three liters of water all over the kitchen. I am using it like it says, but it doesn't work well at all.
customer_reviews.author: Irishsean

customer_reviews.title: I'd Recommend
customer_reviews.text: I'd definitely recommend this if you're in a bind and need your clothes washed. Some quick things that may be helpful: 1. Definitely rinse your clothes after the first load with laundry detergent - I guess it depends on how much detergent you use, but the clothes can get coated in it pretty easily. 2. Can start to smell pretty quickly - I'd recommend doing a cold rinse with soap and water to make it smell a little nicer. other than that, love it.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT SOLUTION FOR LAUNDRY FOR ON A BOAT OR VACATION
customer_reviews.text: Got this for doing laundry on our sailboat over the winter in Florida. Worked beautifully, though only did about 5 loads so far. Such an improvement over using public laundromats while going from place to place. Highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Todd B. Rogers

customer_reviews.title: It holds a good size load
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for two weeks and have done several loads of wash. It holds a good size load. I washed two bath towels, 2 face towels, a wash cloth, two shirts, and two pairs of underwear in one load. I have also washed a set of sheets: top, bottom and three pillow cases in one load. I am very pleased with how clean my wash is and how effortlessly I can do a load of wash. It does have some minor leakage from the value on the bottom of the washer when it drains but it is minimal. Just plan for that happening. I highly recommend buying the spin dryer by The Laundry Alternative to use with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah L McKee

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Here in the midst of the pandemic, I wasn’t keen on visiting a laundromat. I tried hand-washing old school but that got tiring. I *love* the Wonder-wash. It’s perfect for my needs- do a load and hang to dry. I experimented with laundry soap and water til I found what worked for me: one soapy wash and one rinse. I thought I had a slight problem when a tiny chain appeared in the draining space but it turns out it was from my pocket. In the meantime I’d written an email to Laundry Alternative customer service, and they were super nice and prompt with their reply. For a hand-wash or machine alternative, I totally recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Henry H

customer_reviews.title: Laundry Alternative Wonderwash Non-electric
customer_reviews.text: The Laundry Alternative Wonderwash Non-electric We are a family of four adults living in an RV full time. On average we spend $20.00 a week at a laundromat, that' works out to $80.00 a month and $960 a year. The Wonderwash has been a remarkable addition to our travel experience and has already saved us money. It's easy to use, saves water and gets all of our clothes nice and clean wherever we are. We never need to wait to find a laundromat. We use the Wonderwash in partner with the Laundry Alternative Mini-spin Dryer, together the job of laundry goes faster.
customer_reviews.author: S. Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Perfect solution to my laundry troubles!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried several other apt washers and got so frustrated with them, I sent them back. Each one just tangled up the arms & legs of my clothes around each other. This one doesn't need electricity and does a great job. I even get a little exercise while using it! I put it on top of a plastic container inside the tub to raise it higher. I also got the Mini Portable spinner to go with it, which spins most of the water out so they dry much faster and without the usual stiffness.
customer_reviews.author: Renee Alter

customer_reviews.title: YEASSS BISH! Where you been all my life!
customer_reviews.text: I organize a team for RAGBRAI (an annual 7 day bike ride across the state of Iowa). One thing we ran into in years past was not always having access to laundry. When you are hauling a team of 40's stuff across the state over the course of a week in the dead of summer and they are cycling all day, you kinda want to give them the ability to wash their stinky sweaty clothes. This was super helpful as they can simply wash while relaxing after an 80 mile day and they don't have to put smelly clothes into a bag to fester. Bravo! A+!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for camping!!
customer_reviews.text: We vacationed at the lake, no grass here, only topsoil to run and play on. This little basin did great, I didn’t pack it as full as other reviewers did, because the dirt here is horrible, but I got everything clean. We’re a family of 5, so I tried to do a couple small loads each day, turning it by hand for 2 minutes to wash/1 minute to rinse each load gets monotonous. All in all I’m happy with it, it saves trips to the laundromat, and I’ll use it at home if god forbid my washer goes out.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Garland

customer_reviews.title: Convenient and reliable.
customer_reviews.text: This conveniently sized hand-crank washing machine has paid for itself saving us from trips to the laundromat. My usual load is a pair of jeans, a few shirts, and some socks or undergarments. After a while the cranking can become tiresome, but is not exhausting. I like to listen to music while I wash so I can turn the crank to the beat! I find the only major downside to this contraption is having to wring the clothes out after washing them.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky Simonetti

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product for Off the Grid living
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product for many years. I currently have 2 units that are used almost every day. I have used "Wonder Wash" units in Iraq, South America and in bush Alaska. I currently live off grid and depend on my machines for everything I wash. They are extremely dependable and do an excellent job every time. I rate this product as one of my most dependable off grid resources. Excellent product!!
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: This protects your hands from the water....to an extent only
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so I could do hand laundry without getting may hands wet. So...My hands got less wet. I still had to deal with soaking wet laundry to take out of the ball and hang on the line. I ended up using it only a few times, because I didn't really see the point of it.
customer_reviews.author: K-USA

customer_reviews.title: It’s okay
customer_reviews.text: Let me say first that yes, it works. I use it for clothes that normally go on a cold cycle, to save some money on the laundromat. Reason for only three stars is the flaky design. The thing leaks during draining and this rems to be getting worse. Draining it also won’t get all the water out. The little protector over the drainage hole inside kept getting loose leaving the clothes to clog up the drainage hole. I ended up glueing the thing in place. The framework the washer hangs in seems flimsy and moves very which way when spinning the washer. So far, it’s not showing cracks, but I’m not holding my breath.
customer_reviews.author: Tamara

customer_reviews.title: Mostly very good
customer_reviews.text: Pay attention to where you place this machine. I found that I could not possibly turn it in the tub (my original preferred location) because doing so was backbreaking. Ah! Pay attention to physics and leverage. When placed at counter height (e.g. edge of sink, just like instructions say) it is easy to manipulate. The little doohickeys that keep the legs from sliding off could have been easier to assemble. I wouldn't have minded using an actual screwdriver to attach them, might have been easier. I adore the Nina Soft Spin Dryer that I bought with this manual washing machine.
customer_reviews.author: Lyric Traveler

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. No scent. The suction cups don't readily work but who who cares. This is a fantastic product. 2 minutes to crank a full load clean 30 seconds to rinse. I hand ring mine. They came out bright and very clean. I used a half a lid of tide liquid detergent and half a lid of gain fabric softner. I love this and use it weakly.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Why didn’t I get one sooner??
customer_reviews.text: We live in an apartment in NYC and hauling our 40Lb bags of laundry up and down the steps then down the block to the laundromat was reallllly getting old. I’ve already used this a few times and for me, it fits a weeks worth of laundry for one person. Super easy to use, super effective. I’m so thankful! I use it in the tub bc I have zero counter space and it’s wonderful. I expected to spend a ton of time wringing the water out but it mimics the spin cycle so the clothes don’t even come out soaked. Best purchase ever if you’re in an apartment. Everyone needs one of these!
customer_reviews.author: Sean Petty

customer_reviews.title: Wash clothes and exercise arms at the same time!
customer_reviews.text: I am writing this review because I am so grateful to have something to wash my clothes in. For the amount of money it costs, I chose to buy this until I can find something a little better in quality. I have been hand washing everything because I hate to go to the laundromat. It will also pay for itself. If it falls apart I am sure I will get a refund from Amazon. My arms will get a nice exercise at the same time! I love doing 2 things at once! Addendum: I just bought a Pyle washer spinner which is fabulous but if the electricity goes out I always have this one to use! Once again, thanks Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Time consuming (even though it only takes seconds)
customer_reviews.text: It took way to much effort. Honestly, I felt good using it, but it was time I didn't really have. You have to drain it and then fill it with cold water multiple times in order to rinse it out. It's hard to get things not sopping wet so it can dry faster.
customer_reviews.author: Alisa

customer_reviews.title: good idea
customer_reviews.text: Use only out side or in bath tub. Leaked alot from the center and the lid not sure if the new lid is better then the old but this one dosnt seal well. Guess the built up pressure has to go some where so out the middle it came. I had high hopes for this. I loved the idea of it just didn't work out as I hoped.
customer_reviews.author: Sacriel

customer_reviews.title: Clothes not clean and does not drain fully
customer_reviews.text: It broke the first time. Some of the parts might be for wrong machine. The drain pipe snapped just using. The legs popped off but I rigged it. This takes far longer than two minutes. The rinsing and wringing means 15 minutes of active work. A barely dirty hiking dirt would not come clean of dirt. Buy a bucket or a real machine. Wringing clothes and sheets of a gallon of water is ridiculous. No spin at all.
customer_reviews.author: Floridayogi

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: This really does a great job of getting your clothes clean. At first it seemed like really a lot of work but once I figured out the right amount of detergent and fabric softener to put it in it is much easier now. It takes quite a bit less than you would think. It was taking me several rinses my first couple washes. Now I get it done with 1 rinse and clothes come out great. Besides saving water and electricity this will save you on soap and softener too.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis S LaRock

customer_reviews.title: It leaked and never stopped until I drained it.
customer_reviews.text: I just got it in the mail today and was so excited. My little one was like let's try it out. Well, as I was adding the water and detergent as the directions says my daughter tells me it is leaking all over the counter. It leaked so bad that water splashed when I tried to use it. I'm not sure if I received a bad product but I did like the concept.
customer_reviews.author: Lawris Lealie

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Love it. My family uses this for our baby’s reusable diapers and delicates. I’ve used both Scented and unscented detergents and the diapers came out clean with both. I also do a round of fabric softener after the rinse. And the diapers come out smelling great, much better than when washed in machines. I eyeball the amount of water and detergents and I’ve had no issues.
customer_reviews.author: damaris

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the money
customer_reviews.text: Good value for the money. I love being able to do my laundry at home, and my clothes do actually get clean. I was amazed to be honest (and fascinated/disgusted at the color of the water after). I even do a rinse cycle with softener in it. This us incrediblely easy to use but I have a few issues (nothing big): 1) The lid is supposed to be water tight but mine leaks a bit, and flings water about. 2) One of the suction cups is wonky, and doesn't grip so I have to brace the framing against something to keep it in place. Other than that, this is a great little washing apparatus.
customer_reviews.author: Elisabeth Eye

customer_reviews.title: This is the best thing since the invention of kitty litter
customer_reviews.text: This is the best thing since the invention of kitty litter!!! Great quality and easy to assemble! I use it weekly for just about everything. Holds about 2 pairs of heavy jeans or the weeks worth of ladies undergarments or 5 t- shirts or 3 towels or a weeks worth of dish towels. Takes about 3 gallons of water to fill it (after you put the clothes in). 3 minutes of churning in each direction. My clothes get cleaner than when I use the laundromat!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kathi Zamora

customer_reviews.title: Buy It!
customer_reviews.text: Used this camping in montana for two weeks and it worked great! Used the liquid he soap in it. Cleaned everything as good as my home machine!
customer_reviews.author: Doran

customer_reviews.title: Hot garbage
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for maybe 3 weeks and it's already broken after twice-weekly use. First the frame pins started popping out - no surprise, it's all just plastic. Then the airtight seal started leaking. Then the lid latch just broke off. Update: The knob on the handle just snapped off. It's now 100% unusable. DO NOT BUY THIS.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Good enough for camping, not a primary washer.
customer_reviews.text: This worked pretty decently, but not as great as was claimed. It was better than nothing while camping, but it came with no instructions for use & I didn't know how much water to add until I was able to get to internet & had to do a lot of trial & error & try to remember the commercial. Takes a fair bit of elbow grease to get it going & far more times changing out the water than claimed. The feet didn't want to adhere. It was decently made though. I'm hoping they'll eventually just put measuring lines inside the drum, to make it fool proof. All in all, I'm glad I bought it, despite my mixed review.
customer_reviews.author: Largely Useless

customer_reviews.title: Basically a bucket.
customer_reviews.text: I feel the quality of this is very good. With that said, there’s literally nothing in this thing. It simply is a bucket with a top that you turn upside down and then upright 200 times. It’s pretty ridiculous honestly. There’s literally nothing this accomplishes that a bucket or a sink wouldn’t . I expected it to have some form of agitator or something like that inside but, it is just a bucket.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay Gamster

customer_reviews.title: Not work.
customer_reviews.text: This thing was not what it was made to look like. It was hard to put together and then it was hard to use and really didnt wash clothes like it was supposed to. Wished I would have gotten another one to try, might have been better then this one.
customer_reviews.author: iesha

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done!
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't believe how good this works. My only suggestion is use HE laundry detergent to avoid the suds, and have something to spin out your clothes. I use the hand crank ringer from Lehman's hardware, or an electric spin dryer of some sort.
customer_reviews.author: I Own My Life

customer_reviews.title: Great for small laundry loads
customer_reviews.text: Bought this unit last year. Have done MANY loads in my off-grid location. Zero complaints. New design has no leaks. Run 3 rinse cliches to get all the soap out and I believe, other than the capacity, the I can not tell the difference in the quality of the wash from a commercial laundromat.
customer_reviews.author: Jos Stark

customer_reviews.title: It is not super durable. If you have kids make sure to supervise them.
customer_reviews.text: This worked ok for us for a few months but the seal on it broke after a few times and it slowly fell apart after that. I gave it to my sister when it was mostly functional and her kids were kind of rough on it too so if you have any kids this probably is not the product you want. My husband and I did like it for when we were traveling though.
customer_reviews.author: teenpower87

customer_reviews.title: So handy
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and even easier to use. My work clothes are particularly filthy and it took three rinses to completely clean them so that’s not too bad considering. The little tube used to drain snaps on perfectly as does everything thing else. Perfect for my apartment so I don’t have to waste time waiting for a machine to be available and/or money on their machines... nor will my bras be stolen anymore so there’s that too
customer_reviews.author: Sophia Martinez

customer_reviews.title: The cheap plastic legs are going to break..
customer_reviews.text: After the first use you can see the rocking and how much stress they put on the cheap plastic legs. I try to pin the legs with my feet to minimize the amount of rocking, but it barely helps. I'll update when the legs finally give way. I haven't seen a way to get replacement parts either. The plastic bits they use to cover up the holes that connect the unit to the legs already have flown off and don't fit snuggly enough to ever stay in with all the movement the spinning does.
customer_reviews.author: Alii

customer_reviews.title: This washer was very nice yes it got my cloths clean (i had a ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a small 2 bedroom apartment, there simply is no room for an actual washer I also live in an older building so even if there was room, I was concerned about the electricity outlets managing the current pull. This washer was very nice yes it got my cloths clean (i had a pair of jeans, and some foundation garments) The jeans I had thrown in had, had black coffee spilled on them and they had a lot of dust as well. They came out clean and smelling nice. My only issue is that I have arthritis very badly and had to hand wring every thing.
customer_reviews.author: marie seay

customer_reviews.title: I like that it's green
customer_reviews.text: After reading many reviews, I decided to buy a Wonderwash in hopes of washing a few small items. I like that it's green, saves on water and doesn't use electricity. However, I had issues with the spout where it did not stay in place. After contacting the company, they sent out a new spout, free of charge and immediately. I really appreciate the customer service of this company. Using the Wonderwash for the first time, I had issues with the spout, not sure how to prevent it from leaking water -- perhaps it's meant to leak out a little when I want to rinse - but the clothes smelled and looked clean.
customer_reviews.author: shopgirl

customer_reviews.title: Portable washer
customer_reviews.text: I was really surprised at how good it cleans clothes. It even removes the lint and pet hair off the clothes. It is easy to use. But I did it the hard way , I put it in the bathtub and stretched across the tub to turn the handle and I use a separate pan to rinse them in . It doesn’t wring the clothes out , you have to do that your self.. I do have a hard time keeping the little pegs in the slots . But it does do a good job. I would recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Joy

customer_reviews.title: Clean clothes
customer_reviews.text: This product is great, quick, easy, clothes get clean. I knock off a star for the build quality. The plastic frame is really flimsy. The caps to cover the joints you snap together pop out while I’m using it and I don’t feel confident giving it a hefty spin in case the frame gives out. The rubber feet are also not helpful for me because they are wider than my countertop. So if you’re in a small place/camper/rv these may also not help you steady the unit while you work.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs S

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I will use it for delicate cloths and for camping Easy to crank and compact design. Direction say no hot water. Wish it would say that on unit itself instead of directions.. Wish on directions it would also have contact information in-case you need spare parts or questions about the product. Wish I had bought this product years ago.
customer_reviews.author: agsb

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I wash everything 3 times. Plus in between rinses. I actually expect that seeing as how dirty my kids get their clothes. I only have to do one wash cycle with my clothes. Super impressed. Tip for negative reviews: if the water isn't clear then they aren't clean yet so do another cycle.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Great Device!
customer_reviews.text: Much larger than expected and plastic material is strong but lightweight. Moves smoothly and cleans well. You must turn it one way about 10 times then reverse direction and spin the other way. That way the clothes do not bunch to the side. I washed once then rinsed twice and clothes look and smell great! Really happy with this little washer.
customer_reviews.author: JAM

customer_reviews.title: It is useful for camping
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product thinking it would save water and money. It does both of those things. But. A honest break down of this mechanism Is. A bucked that you can spin with a handle and drain with a sligh vacuum pressure. It is useful for camping. But not useful if you have runnin water, a bath tub, a sink, or a bucket that you can drain. I am not trying to push you away from the product. But help you understand that you can achieve this goal with what you have at home. And if not.m, BUY IT.
customer_reviews.author: Raecheal

customer_reviews.title: Super
customer_reviews.text: This is AMAZING!!! Our washer died on is and we can't afford to buy another right now, so I decided to give this a whirl. Literally the best thing I've invested in. It takes less time using this than the actual washer and the clothes come out just as clean. I mean, yeah, you have to do a bunch of little loads, but it still less time. I may not buy another washer.
customer_reviews.author: murkywater16

customer_reviews.title: Has potential
customer_reviews.text: Overall this could be great. I bought one of these and it leaked at the drain area and the frame popped apart while using. If those two flaws where fixed then this would be fantastic. This is super easy to use and the cloths come out great. Hopefully soon they can come up with a better frame design. I ended up returning mine because of the flaws.
customer_reviews.author: Facepalm

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: This thing does the job and keeps my laundry pile down. I have a toddler and there is never enough clean clothes before laundry day. With this, I'm easily able to ensure clean clothing for my toddler as well as the rest of the house while getting a good arm workout at the same time! I haven't tried anything big like jeans or other pants but I imagine washing that kind of material wont be as successful. Best part of all of this, you can take it anywhere. Camping this summer is going to go a lot easier.
customer_reviews.author: davikzca

customer_reviews.title: Great manual washing machine!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great manual washing machine. Easy to set up and use. Gets clothes very clean. However... there is no spin cycle. You have to let it drain and clothes are very wet when you remove them. If using outdoors... no problem, but if using in an apartment... use near a sink and wring your clothes as best you can.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Great Project - Wish it was made a little stronger.
customer_reviews.text: Great product, easy to use. Just a thought, plastic used to support the container should be much stronger. It can barely hold the weight of the water, it sounds like it is going to crack every time you turn the handle. So maybe make them stronger or sell replacement parts Other than that, it is very handy and works well! overall very happy with the product,
customer_reviews.author: PAULA SALAMONE

customer_reviews.title: Honestly not impressed
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this. I love the concept The size The design But It IS gimmicky, I tested it, followed the instructions to a T and it didn’t work enough to remove basic soiling after trying to cycle it twice. Too bad, it was worth a shot i guess
customer_reviews.author: Cass

customer_reviews.title: There's definitely a learning curve
customer_reviews.text: Once you figure out how full, how much soap and how long to go for, it's actually a great little washing machine. The only problem I have with it is that the frame is really cheaply made and it often comes apart while you're turning it. You just have to pop it back together and you're good to go, but when it's happening a couple of times every single wash, it does get annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina S

customer_reviews.title: Fits and spins in standard laundry sink.
customer_reviews.text: Yes it's cheap plastic. Yes the close come out dripping wet, but clean. Yes the new clamp seal design is the weak link. Yes IT FITS, SPINS and DRAINS in a standard laundry sink, which is the gamechanger for me. Throw away the silly drain pipe. The machine performs as stated, no more no less.
customer_reviews.author: dane714

customer_reviews.title: Works well with some minor issues
customer_reviews.text: Finally took the plunge and bought this product. I used it four times so far and can really see where we will save a ton of water on doing laundry at under 3 gallons per full load. It is easy to use and lightweight. A couple of cons include the suction cups (they are terrible) and the stand itself (cheap plastic). Otherwise, a good purchase at under 50 bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Get one, you won't regret it!
customer_reviews.text: Fits about 2 full outfits and makes it very easy to clean. The setup was simple. It does have a learning curve to get things really clean, I like to do a rinse cycle, just means I drain the water and refill. Only thing I don't like is the suction cups on the bottom are flimsy and don't stick in my tub or anywhere else I've tried it. Biggest potential negative is the drain pipe, if it cracks you can't do much. Great product overall!
customer_reviews.author: RN and EMT-I

customer_reviews.title: Read the instructions
customer_reviews.text: This product does exactly what it says it will do. But, don't over fill it with cloths or water. Be very careful with how much laundry detergent you put in! I don't use the drain spout on the bottom, I just hold the cloths on the inside and turn it over to dump the water out.
customer_reviews.author: Whomp

customer_reviews.title: Not Pratical
customer_reviews.text: I tried this with lightly soiled towels. First without soaking then soaking it for an hour. The wash did an OK job, but with the time and effort for a few pieces or clothing, or one towel, or a pair of jeans, I can do the job with a 2 dollar plastic wash bin. Using much less time and energy, and getting a much better result
customer_reviews.author: Billy C

customer_reviews.title: Good device for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Find the ways to let this device be efficient for you and it's a good little washer. If you can run a hose to it with a on/off valve by the washer it saves a LOT of hauling water with a bucket. Then it's a very efficient little machine. I suspect you could get an adapter to put between your bathroom/kitchen faucet and a short garden/washing- machine hose, to fill with. I used this about every day for about a month, and it was a big help.
customer_reviews.author: David A.

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price, saves me time
customer_reviews.text: This helps me a lot. I used to have to wash a small amount at a time in the kitchen sink. Now I can wash more at a time and my clothes got clean. One happy woman.
customer_reviews.author: Maryam Crosnoe

customer_reviews.title: Good Better BEST!
customer_reviews.text: How would you feel if you made a purchase and it performed as stated, if not BETTER. Better is what i got with this washer. So simple so wonderful. I wash my size 13 tennis shoes in it; i was my cloth face mask in it. It’s sturdy and built to last. This was a great find for me.
customer_reviews.author: emerson able

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful WonderWash!
customer_reviews.text: If you have assigned laundry duties to one of your children, and that child doesn't like to wash your "delicates", then this portable washing machine is your savior. I personally don't see what the problem is with loading undies into the washing machine, but DD (age 17) is a little OCD and she can't bring herself to wash other people's panties. No problem with this mini washer, because in only a few minutes I can have a small pile of them taken care of and ready to hang dry! Actually, they are probably cleaner and fresher with the WonderWash, because I can give them an extra rinse to be sure there is no soap remaining. Well worth the $.
customer_reviews.author: Leann Buss

customer_reviews.title: Overall results very good!
customer_reviews.text: I could gripe about a lot of little things* but used within parameters I get very good results: clean, fresh laundry. I would put this product up against any average machine washer. I use it outside on the deck/ picnic bench because I can’t seem to manage not to get everything around me, including myself, wet. *I wish it was bigger. More capacity would be nice. I wish it was smaller. Easier to carry and use. I wish it came with a wringer attachment Blah blah blah.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher W Fugate

customer_reviews.title: This little washer really works.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my small RV for when I'm out boondocking for extended periods. It was easy to assemble and gets my clothes clean. I will say if you have dirty, grimy socks it's best to pre-soak them first, but normally soiled clothes are good to go. Only complaint is what are all those little inserts along the base for? I put them in but the darn things keep falling out.
customer_reviews.author: James Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: I liked it!! It works as I expected. Did not used the drain hose, seems like the lid works fine, I used it to rinse off my clothes, 3 rinses, spin about 10 times each way each time and that’s it...!!! Wish they have a bigger one, like 2x or bigger, plus a hand spinner but that’s plus need to me metal built or something strong... thank you !!!!!
customer_reviews.author: danny V.

customer_reviews.title: Watery mess but clean clothes
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to spill out water and clothes if you’re not careful but the washing quality is awesome. I just bought this and have used it twice for camping in my rv. Works good except if you look in my video it leaks everywhere. Needless to say I wouldn’t use this inside because water does get everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Kati Wallace

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING!!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this little washer!! It's so much easier than taking everything to the laundromat and more fun to use than hand washing. (I have alot of lightweight clothes that would be destroyed at a laundromat, this washer keeps them looking new!!) I was really surprised at how clean it has gotten everything. I use the Laundry Alternative Spin Dryer after washing, and then hang-dry. The money saved from not having to go to the laundromat, or to replace damaged clothes will pay for this machine (for me), in a month!!
customer_reviews.author: Sher

customer_reviews.title: Yet another big plastic gizmo I did not need.
customer_reviews.text: Once I got the thing and saw how much space it occupied, and then I used it I was underwhelmed. My basin started to look pretty good and it is way more space efficient. I use very little soap and not much water to wash in a basin so this gizmo is unnecessary and I sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: westward home

customer_reviews.title: We pretty much wash what we wear every day and leave ...
customer_reviews.text: This little thing has been a life saver as we don't have to worry about bothering our friends or spending a whole day at the laundromat. We pretty much wash what we wear every day and leave it hanging to dry. This product is intended for people who do not have a conventional means of washing clothing. For that, it works. Don't try to replace your washing machine at home because this is not an easy solution for you if you get easily frustrated or don't like working for things.
customer_reviews.author: ryan

customer_reviews.title: This product is easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This product is easy to use, but it does not seem super structurally sound. (Little pieces pop out all the time, a section appears to be held together by tape.) Overall it seems cheap. It's also very small, my husband only uses it for underwear and socks. It hasn't replaced trips to the laundry mat for us, but its nice for small loads throughout the week.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: DoNT BUY THIS
customer_reviews.text: not even worth five dollars the drain broke when putting it together so its bascicly a usless plastic bucke that spins please dont buy this garbage ill take the loss but dammm im better off cleaning clothes in the bath tub
customer_reviews.author: Frank Colcord

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME DOESN'T EVEN BEGIN TO DESCRIBE IT!
customer_reviews.text: I love this washing machine. It sure beats hand washing any day. One load is done super quick, and uses less water than ordinary washing machines! High-efficiency washers use 15-30 gallons of water per load, and older washers use 29-45 gallons per each load. This is so much easier and will save a ton of time and money in the long run!. I'm very satisfied with this product! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Anonymously

customer_reviews.title: Great washer, just needed a dryer.
customer_reviews.text: This little wonder saved my husband and I hundreds of dollars over the years. We moved into our 1st apartment and the washer and dryer at the complex was expensive and not reliable. We bought this guy to save a few dollars and besides the wringing out the water and having a line in the bathroom, it was a great little device that held enough clothes and washed them well.
customer_reviews.author: Doria Matos

customer_reviews.title: Great for quick cleaning
customer_reviews.text: Great for quick cleaning, and for mostly avoiding the laundromat. I'm a college student so it's nice to be able to get a few necessary items clean without spending an hour doing a full load out of the house, plus it really reduces the ecological footprint of doing laundry! One thing this machine can't handle is cat fur so I don't think I'll be cutting out the laundromat altogether.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Happy with this washer
customer_reviews.text: Happy with this washer. Very simple to use, just a little clumsy. I use it in my bathtub, so that the water can drain right out into the tub drain. I bought this with the Nina Soft Dryer, and the two products have made doing laundry so much easier for me. I can wash my delicates, gym clothes, and other small loads as frequently as I wish without the hassle and expense of using my building's communal washer/dryer. My clothes seem to come out so much cleaner and fresh smelling as well. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: ElleNYC17

customer_reviews.title: Where's the wringer?
customer_reviews.text: I thought it came with a wringer. I like it, but the drain pipe needs a re-design. I have cut my hand trying to get it off. I now use an oven mitt to remove the drain pipe. Good price. Paired with my Magic Chef 3.5 cu ft dryer, out motorhome had a perfect laundry set up!
customer_reviews.author: Hand tool beginner

customer_reviews.title: How have you been making this product for like a decade and no assembly instructions
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Minus two stars because no assembly instructions included. None on website. How have you been making this product for like a decade and no assembly instructions? Come on.
customer_reviews.author: JTown

customer_reviews.title: Great for light fabrics
customer_reviews.text: I can't attest to how this would hold up with heavy use but for my purposes - washing delicate and light fabrics - it's fine. Clothing washed by hand with natural soap can last two to three times longer than if washed in a machine with harsh chemical soap. Using this item is much quicker and more effective than hand washing.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia

customer_reviews.title: Not as sturdy as I hoped, but saves a ton of water and detergent
customer_reviews.text: Uses hardly any water compared to 50+ gallons per load in a regular washing machine. Downsides..... Drips a lot when draining; you'll need to put a towel down. Stand seems pretty flimsy, but suction cups are mega strong. This was actually kind of annoying, because it makes it almost impossible to turn it around and use the other hand or even move it in general. Trying to turn/move it made the stand bend significantly and several of the end caps popped off, and I was afraid it would break if I moved it. Better just to put it on a beach towel and crank it gently. Gravity does a pretty good job of holding it in place
customer_reviews.author: Shorty

customer_reviews.title: Be prepared for a work out!
customer_reviews.text: I live on the 8th floor and my laundry room is in the cellar. My elevator will be out of 10 weeks. This is a help for small thing. Easy to assemble and use. Shipped and received quickly. It is a work out on the arms to use and not fond of ringing stuff out but its definitely a big help.
customer_reviews.author: Babes6

customer_reviews.title: Gets items clean quickly with very little water
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for delicate items! Earth friendly! You can fit a full outfit in this thing including a pair of jeans. Ideal for camping or washing all of those delicate items like bras and lingerie. It uses very little water and was a blessing to have when our regular washing machine was in need of a part that took two weeks to ship!
customer_reviews.author: NoName

product_meta.title: The Laundry Alternative - The Wonder Wash Compact Washing Machine - Non-Electric, Hand-Cranked Small Portable Washer - Perfect for Cleaning Woolens, Silks, Knits and Cashmere - 5-Pound Capacity
product_meta.description: A hand-powered, portable washer that can clean your clothes in a flash, the revolutionary Wonder Wash is the next generation in green, cleaner laundry alternatives. And thanks to its compact design, it’s an ideal laundry solution for apartments, campers, single people, RV’s, mobile homes, cabins, and anyone who frequently washes small loads. For product support please contact The Laundry Alternative at 661.238.6684
feature_bullets: PORTABLE: Wire-free mini washer is perfect for an apartment, studio, RV or to take with you camping.
ECO-FRIENDLY: Manual crank operation uses no electricity and 90% less water that standard machines.
GENTLER ON CLOTHES: Best washer for woolens, silks, knits, cashmere and other delicate garments.
BUILT TO LAST: No motor or internal moving parts allow for a longer lifespan than electric washers.
TRUST THE LAUNDRY ALTERNATIVE: We stand by our products. Every item comes with a 3-year warranty.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars1,804 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
